newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times front page - Oct 22.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page Tuesday:
- U.S. Special Coordinator for the Middle East Dennis Ross left Jerusalem for the United States without a pact on Hebron following a series of Israeli-Palestinian talks.
- South Africa's former police chief confessed having ordered acts of terror against blacks during the country's era of apartheid.
- Liberal Alliance candidate Arnoldo Aleman had a 10-percent lead against Nicaragua's former president in incomplete official returns from the country's presidential elections.
- The U.S. Supreme Court dismissed the first constitutional challenge that it has considered regarding the military's policy that assumes that homosexuals are not fit for service.
- American Indian tribes have stopped archeological research on hundreds of prehistoric remains throughout the United States.
- Republican presidential candidate Bob Dole's aggressive campaign against President Bill Clinton has not improved his standing in public opinion polls. -- New York Newsdesk (212) 859-1610
